meanings.definition: A band of tissue connecting two parts of the body, such as the fraenum linguae connecting the tongue to the floor of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The fraenums in my mouth help keep my tongue in place.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the fraenums in my mouth are perfectly normal.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my fraenums were like tiny bridges in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The fraenums in my mouth are like delicate threads holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: I imagined my fraenums as tiny elastic bands keeping my tongue secure.

meanings.sent1: The dentist mentioned that my fraenums needed attention.
meanings.sent2: I learned that fraenums are important for oral health.
meanings.sent3: I saw a group of fraenums hanging from the ceiling - just kidding!
meanings.sent4: The fraenums in the room seemed to symbolize unity and connection.
meanings.sent5: The fraenums on the model showed the intricate network of tissues.
